snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York assailed his Republican opponent, Rob Astorino, while Mr. Astorino said the governor’s showing in the Democratic contest was a “major embarrassment.”
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo sees primary results, in which little-known law professor Zephyr Teachout won third of vote and roughly half of New York's counties, as validation for his campaign of bravely taking on special interests; Republican challenger Rob Astorino calls results 'major embarrassment' for Cuomo.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York assailed his Republican opponent, Rob Astorino, while Mr. Astorino said the governor’s showing in the Democratic contest was a “major embarrassment.”

headline.main: Cuomo Says He’s ‘Fine With 60%’ in Primary and Looks to General Election
headline.print_headline: In Race for Governor, Nominees Take Stock of Their Odds
